sprechertext.p: Hi, and welcome to the United States of America! I’m Emily, and these are my USA photos. You can also try my USA quiz!

inhalteelement.p: This is one of the most beautiful places in the USA – Monument Valley.
We always celebrate on 4th July. The USA got its independence from Britain on that day in 1776. There are always a lot of flags too!
The White House is where the president of the USA lives and works. It’s in the capital, Washington, D.C.
We use dollars and cents in the USA. There are pictures of American presidents on the money.
The Native Americans lived here before the Europeans came.

inhalteelement.p: New York City (NYC) is the largest city in the United States. There are five boroughs: The Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens and Staten Island. Here you can see Times Square in Manhattan. It’s one of the most famous places in the city.
The United States is a country of immigrants. Many of them saw the Statue of Liberty when they arrived in the USA. The statue is on a small island near Manhattan. It was a present from France.
Baseball is one of the most popular sports in the USA, and New Yorkers love it. Some players are really big stars.

The city is a very expensive place. A lot of young people there work as bike messengers or in cafés. Bike messengers often ride through Central Park, a large park in Manhattan. There are some lakes in the park too.

New York is a multicultural city. Many people went to live there from Italy, for example. There is still a large Italian population today. You can see many Italian restaurants in ‘Little Italy’ in Manhattan.

aufgabenstellung.p: Read the interview with José Blanco.

sprechertext.p: Hello José. Can I ask you some questions for our magazine, please?
Hi. Sure.
You’re a new star on one of New York’s best baseball teams. Where are you from?
My family is from Cuba.
How long have you lived in the USA?
I’ve lived here for 13 years.
Your parents left their home country. Was that easy?
No, it was a difficult decision. But they were very poor. My father couldn’t find work in Cuba. My parents wanted to give my sister and me the best opportunities.
What were the first years like for your family?
It was difficult because my parents couldn’t speak English well. But other people from Cuba helped them. Later my parents opened a small store.
How did you feel?
I was a new arrival. Everything was very new and exciting. Later I was sad because I was homesick. But I got used to life here. I haven’t been homesick for a long time.
You’re 23 now. How long have you played baseball?
I’ve played baseball for eight years. I’ve had lots of opportunities since 2015. That’s when I became the star of my school team.
You’ve had a successful career!

Yes, I have. My story is a great example of the American Dream. I was a new arrival and I wanted to be successful. I have been an American citizen since December last year. For most people it’s much harder.Interviewer: So, what about your plans?
Well, I often talk to people in Cuba, and I’d like to help them.
Thank you, José. Good luck for the future.

inhalteelement.p: Die Idee des amerikanischen Traums ist, dass jeder hart arbeiten und so ein besseres Leben erreichen kann. Manche Einwanderer wurden sogar Millionäre, z.B. der Jeans-Hersteller Levi Strauss, der aus der Nähe von Bamberg kam. Was denkst du über den amerikanischen Traum?

aufgabenstellung.p: There is a new student at your school. The student has come from a different country. You want to know more about him/her. Prepare an interview with a partner.
Think about these points:

li.p: where the student is from (Where are you from?)
how long the student has been here (How long have you been…?)
why the student came to Germany
the student’s plans for the future
what the student knows about Germany and Bavaria
Where are you from? – I’m from…
How long have you been…? – I’ve been in Germany for…
Why did you come to Germany? – I wanted to come to Germany because my parents wanted to find work here/because life in… was very difficult/dangerous.
What are your plans for the future? – In the future I want to find work in Germany/learn German/drive a car.
What do you know about Germany and Bavaria? – I’ve been to Germany before. I know that there are very good German cars and I’ve heard of the famous football team from Munich.

inhalteelement.p: Denke daran, dein Interview höflich zu beginnen und zu beenden. Verwende „Please“, „Thank you“ und „You’re welcome“. Zeige Interesse. Wenn du etwas nicht verstehst, sage: „Sorry, can you repeat that, please?“ Versuche zu helfen, wenn jemand stecken bleibt.

inhalteelement.p: Ich kann ein Interview führen. ✔
Hier lerne ich, über Einflüsse verschiedener Kulturen im Alltag zu sprechen.

aufgabenstellung.p: Read a magazine article about teenagers in New York.
We talked to four young people about life in New York. This is what they told us…

sprechertext.p: I live in the borough of Queens with my parents and my sister. We moved here when I was four. People of all nationalities live happily together here. There are Chinatowns in Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens. In some parts of Queens there are street signs in Chinese.

I was born in Jamaica, but my family moved to Brooklyn in 2010. Brooklyn is a fantastic place. There are so many cool stores with clothes and shoes. One of my favorite days is Labor Day, in September. There is a parade in Brooklyn on that day. The people in the parade always play music very loudly.

We’re from Russia, but we’ve lived in the USA for ten years. Our apartment is in Harlem, a part of Manhattan. Everyone walks quickly here – Harlem is an awesome place, but it isn’t a place for slow people! The food is amazing. There are many different restaurants – Italian, Turkish, Japanese and Spanish. They cook really well here!

I’m from the Bronx. I was born here, and I’ve lived here all my life. I live with my mom, my uncle and my cousin. My mom came here from Cuba in the 1980s. She speaks English badly, so we speak Spanish at home. I love it here, but life isn’t always easy. People work hard, and some parts of town aren’t safe at night. Sometimes we visit the zoo in the Bronx. It’s near our apartment.

I live in the borough of Queens with my parents and my sister. We moved here when I was four. People of all nationalities live happily together here. There are Chinatowns in Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens. In some parts of Queens there are street signs in Chinese.

I was born in Jamaica, but my family moved to Brooklyn in 2010. Brooklyn is a fantastic place. There are so many cool stores with clothes and shoes. One of my favorite days is Labor Day, in September. There is a parade in Brooklyn on that day. The people in the parade always play music very loudly.

We’re from Russia, but we’ve lived in the USA for ten years. Our apartment is in Harlem, a part of Manhattan. Everyone walks quickly here – Harlem is an awesome place, but it isn’t a place for slow people! The food is amazing. There are many different restaurants – Italian, Turkish, Japanese and Spanish. They cook really well here!

musterloesung.p: I live in Regensburg. It’s a city in Germany.

There are many Italian and Turkish restaurants here. There’s also a Chinese shop where you can buy sweet and sour rice. When you look around Regensburg, you can see many snack bars with Turkish kebabs. Sometimes the people in the shops speak Turkish and German. Many tourists from other countries visit Regensburg every year. Many of them like to try pretzels or sausages. Some people in Regensburg celebrate Eid. It’s a special day for muslims.

aufgabenstellung.p: Look at the pictures. What do you think will happen in the story?

musterloesung.p: A girl and a man will have an argument./Maybe the girl on the bike will have an accident./The girl will call the police./The police officer will talk to the girl and the man in a wheelchair.

aufgabenstellung.p: Read the story.

It was half past eight in the evening when my phone rang. “Hey Ally, there’s a job for you. Can you get a package with clothes from Romero Fashions at 616, Monroe Street and take it to 91, Tillary Street fast? They need it in half an hour!”
“OK. I’m on my way,” I said.
My name is Alice Dawson and I’m a bike messenger in New York. I use my bike and I deliver packages very fast. I’m from Brooklyn, so I know all the streets here really well.
I got the package and went back to my bike. I went up Monroe Street really fast.
Suddenly a white van went past me and turned right. I tried to stop, but the van knocked me off my bike. But I was lucky. I fell on the package.
The van stopped and a man got out. There were some scratches on his van.
“Look what you’ve done to my van!” the man shouted angrily.
I was angry too. “You turned right and didn’t signal!” I answered. “I’m calling the police!”
“You can say what you like!” the man said. “You don’t have any witnesses!”
I knew that he was right. There was no one in the street at this time of the evening.
Ten minutes later a police officer arrived and talked to us. She thought the scratches on the van weren’t too bad, but my bike was wrecked.
The driver got in his van and drove off. Police officer Ling said, “Well, the problem is that you don’t have any witnesses.”
“Yes, but I think I saw someone in the window in that building,” I said. “I think it was a man.”
“In the first floor apartment? OK, let’s look.”
The name on the door said Mancini. We rang the doorbell. Then a man opened the door. He was about 50 and he was in a wheelchair.
“What do you want?” the man said excitedly. He had a strong Italian accent.
“There was an accident in the road near your apartment,” Officer Ling answered.
“What are you talking about?” Mr Mancini asked.
I said, “A driver knocked me off my bike. I saw you in the window.”
“No, no. That’s wrong,” said Mr Mancini.
“Have you ever seen this lady?” Officer Ling asked him.
“No, I haven’t.”
“And did you see the driver?”
“No, I didn’t. I didn’t see the man in the van.”
“You’re lying!” I shouted. “I saw you!”
“OK, prove it!” the man answered.
“I think we can, Mr Mancini,” Officer Ling said quietly. “I know that you’re not telling the truth.”

Hi Mandy,
Guess what? I had an accident on my bike…
had a new job… • van turned… and didn’t… • bike was wrecked… • didn’t have any… • called the… • rang the… • talked to… • didn’t tell… • knew because he said “I…”

musterloesung.p: Guess what? I had an accident on my bike. I had a new job. On the way to Tillary Street a van turned right and didn’t signal. It knocked me off my bike. My bike was wrecked. I didn’t have any witnesses.

I called the police. We rang the doorbell and talked to a man in a wheelchair. He didn’t help us. But he wasn’t telling the truth. The police officer knew because he said, “I didn’t see the man in the van.”
I hope my next job will be better. How are you?

aufgabenstellung.p: Prepare a short presentation about bike messengers in New York. Find a good photo on the internet and look for this information. (The tips on page 19 can help you.)

li.p: What do bike messengers deliver?
How fast do they ride? Is their job safe or dangerous? What do they wear?
And you? (Would you like this job?)

aufgabenstellung.p: Give your presentation.

musterloesung.p: Bike messengers are people who work for messenger companies. They are often young men and women. They deliver presents, clothes or other important things which people cannot send online. Sometimes the people just need the package to arrive fast. Bike messengers often have a bag and wear a helmet. They usually ride fast (about 12 miles an hour). The work can be dangerous. The bike messenger must be careful and cars should signal when they turn right. I would like this job because it’s exciting to ride a bike in a big city like New York.

inhalteelement.p: My phone rang and I answered it fast. I’m John, a bike messenger, and I’m the best in NYC. On sunny days I always wait on Lexington Avenue between jobs. There’s a great café and it’s in the middle of New York.

I had to go to Lenox Hill Hospital at 2:30 p.m., get some important papers and take them to Harlem Hospital Center. I was near to Lenox Hill Hospital and this was a race against time to save someone’s life. I only had 20 minutes to do the job. It wouldn’t be easy. I got to Lenox Hill Hospital in a minute. Not bad. I put the package in my bag quickly.

Only 18 minutes left. Why are all the traffic lights red? OK, now it’s good… green, green, green. Right to Madison Avenue, then left to 5th Avenue. There aren’t many tourists here. Into Central Park, past the lakes. There are lots of people on their bikes or jogging. Three more streets, two, one. I can see the hospital.
I’m at the hospital now. Job done in 19 minutes and 24 seconds and, I hope, a life saved.

aufgabenstellung.p: Read the text. Match the headings with the right parts (A−D) of the text.

My phone rang and I answered it fast. I’m John, a bike messenger, and I’m the best in NYC. On sunny days I always wait on Lexington Avenue between jobs. There’s a great café and it’s in the middle of New York.

I had to go to Lenox Hill Hospital at 2:30 p.m., get some important papers and take them to Harlem Hospital Center. I was near to Lenox Hill Hospital and this was a race against time to save someone’s life. I only had 20 minutes to do the job. It wouldn’t be easy. I got to Lenox Hill Hospital in a minute. Not bad. I put the package in my bag quickly.

Only 18 minutes left. Why are all the traffic lights red? OK, now it’s good… green, green, green. Right to Madison Avenue, then left to 5th Avenue. There aren’t many tourists here. Into Central Park, past the lakes. There are lots of people on their bikes or jogging. Three more streets, two, one. I can see the hospital.
I’m at the hospital now. Job done in 19 minutes and 24 seconds and, I hope, a life saved.

aufgabenitem.p: A job well done

musterloesung.p: Today I will tell you some facts about whales. Whales are beautiful animals that live in the sea. You can go whale-watching near Cape Cod in the USA. There are different kinds of whale. The blue whale is the largest animal on earth. The biggest blue whale was 30.5 metres long. Small blue whales can be as heavy as about 100 people. Another whale is the narwhal. It has the longest tooth. Bowhead whales live for a very long time. Some become 200 years old! That was my presentation about whales. I used these websites:
